meanings.sent1: The fore row of seats offers the best view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: The fore part of the ship faced the open sea.
meanings.sent3: The fore position in line helped him see the movie screen clearly.
meanings.sent4: Her fore position in the race gave her an advantage over the other runners.
meanings.sent5: The fore door of the house welcomed guests with a warm glow.

meanings.sent1: He had never seen such a beautiful sunset fore.
meanings.sent2: The students lined up fore entering the classroom.
meanings.sent3: She always finished her homework fore going out to play.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirped fore the sun rose in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The cake was baked fore the party started.

meanings.definition: A warning shouted to people in the path of a golf ball
meanings.sent1: The golfer yelled 'fore' to alert others of the incoming ball.
meanings.sent2: The loud 'fore' saved the spectators from getting hit.
meanings.sent3: The 'fore' echoed across the golf course, causing everyone to duck.
meanings.sent4: The 'fore' warning made the players quickly cover their heads.
meanings.sent5: The 'fore' shout made everyone look up in alarm.
